meanings.definition: To decorate excessively or too elaborately.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overdecorate her house for every holiday, with lights and decorations covering every inch.
meanings.sent2: Some people overdecorate their Christmas trees with so many ornaments that you can't even see the branches.
meanings.sent3: The party planner decided to overdecorate the venue with streamers and balloons, making it look like a circus.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit was like an overdecorated cake, with layers of jewelry and sparkles that seemed too much for a casual gathering.
meanings.sent5: The garden was overdecorated with so many flowers that it looked like a colorful explosion.

meanings.definition: To adorn or embellish to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overdecorate his cakes with elaborate frosting designs and edible flowers.
meanings.sent2: Some people overdecorate their cars with stickers and accessories, making them stand out in traffic.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to overdecorate the painting with intricate patterns, turning it into a mesmerizing masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was overdecorated with flowery language, making it hard to understand the main point.
meanings.sent5: The room was overdecorated with so many paintings that it felt like walking through an art gallery.
